intro: Galega hirta, commonly known as goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in dense, branched clusters. Galega hirta is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
